description: Oksana Lintz privately decides to withhold Halden’s cache, urging neighborhood assemblies to organize a public tribunal for transparent justice.
Assemblies publicly announce preparations for a citywide tribunal, inviting citizens and witnesses impacted by BCI abuses.
The public tribunal opens, live-streamed across districts. Oksana submits the evidence, and testimony from whistleblowers and affected residents details BCI abuses and erasures.

Council and Directorate members face direct citizen questioning. Oksana openly addresses her emergency patch, admitting both necessity and risk, while witnesses expose the human cost of BCI manipulation.
Following days of testimony, citizens vote to disband the Council, repurpose BCI infrastructure for participatory governance, and commit to open assembly-based decision making.
